nodes.title: II.2. Superficial structures: Primarily funerary superstructure
Oral tradition
nodes.body: According to local sources, DeurukRde’u rug is a site of ancient burial mounds.

nodes.title: Upper sector
nodes.body: The funerary structures of the upper sector tend to have longer east-west dimensions, the sides of the structures that run perpendicular to the axis of the slope. This is a common feature of terraced structures hroughout the far eastern JangtangByang thang. These structures are referred to as tombs in this survey, even though it is possible that certain examples fulfilled non-sepulchral funerary functions.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS2
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS2 (10 m x 10 m) is situated directly below FS1 (34.135΄ / 09.766΄). It is elevated about 1.5 m on its uphill side and perhaps 5 m on its downhill side.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS3
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS3 (9 m x 10 m) is situated directly below FS1 (34.138΄ / 09.748΄). It has a rear flank hat is flush with the slope. The height of the forward flank could not be determined.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS4
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS4 (14.4 m x 12 m) is situated on the same prow as FS2 and FS3 (34.133΄ / 09.734΄). FS4 is so highly eroded that it is barely recognizable.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS5
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS5 (23 m x 22 m) is situated a little higher than FS1 (34.164΄ / 09.722΄). The rear flank is flush with the slope, while the forward flank is elevated, perhaps 7 m above the downhill slope. There is a depression 1.5 m deep in the top of the structure.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS6
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS6 (13 m x 9 m) is situated west of FS5 at the same elevation (34.160΄ / 09.703΄). FS6 is so degraded as to be almost beyond recognition. Its uphill side is level with the slope. To the west of FS6, he slopes are highly dissected and do not appear to host funerary structures.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS7
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS7 (11 m x 9 m) is situated below FS6 (34.138΄ / 09.706΄). Its rear side is elevated about 1 m above the uphill slope. There is a concavity in the middle of the top of the structure.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS8
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS8 (12.5 m x 10 m) has a rear flank that is elevated about 2 m above the slope (34.134΄ / 09.663΄). The top 3 m of the forward flank appear to have constituted a vertical expanse.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS10
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS10 (37 m x 20 m) is situated at an elevation intermediate to that of FS8 and FS9, as well as farther west of them (34.116΄ / 09.647΄). The north/rear flank of the structure is elevated 1.5 m to 4 m above the adjoining terrain. There is a vertical expanse, 4 m in height, at the top of the forward flank. Below this vertical area, the sloping forward flank may have continued for another 6 m vertical. On the flattish top of FS10 an L-shaped trench, 3 m in length, was recently dug. This neatly executed excavation, the work of a sophisticated group, is 3 m deep. This does not appear to be an example of the desultory digging of DeurukRde’u rug structure by local people. Between FS9 and FS10 there is an excavation in the ground surface that reveals many subsurface stones.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS11
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS11 (12 m x 11 m) is the most westerly of the north sector tombs (34.121΄ / 09.611΄). Very little of this structure is still extant. There appear to be the faint vestiges of masonry walls on the op of FS11.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS12
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS12 (9 m x 8 m) is situated at the same elevation as FS10 and FS11 (34.118΄ / 09.600΄).

nodes.title: Lower sector
nodes.body: The funerary structures of the lower sector often have longer east-west side, thus most of them share the same alignment as those of the upper sector. These structures are referred to as tombs in this survey, even though it is possible that certain examples fulfilled non-burial funerary functions.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS13
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS13 (30 m x 28 m) is the most westerly tomb of the main lower sector aggregation (34.077΄ / 09.550΄). FS13 is 2 m to 4 m in height.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS14
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS14 (29 x 25 m) is situated directly below FS12 (34.089΄ / 09.600΄). It has an elevation of 4 m to 6 m above the surrounding terrain.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS15
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS15 (18 m x 18 m) is slightly elevated on its rear/north flank and 3 m to 4 m high on its forward flank (34.051΄ / 09.599΄). There is an earthen platform 6 m west of FS15. This quadrate platform measures 17 m (east-west) x 20 m (north-south) and is elevated about 1 m above the surrounding terrain. This platform is probably a funerary structure of some kind.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS16
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS16 (27 m x 22 m) is elevated 4 m to 5 m above the surrounding terrain (34.018΄ / 09.595΄). Just north of it, on clear level ground, there is a discontinuous single line of stones. This manmade feature is probably a funerary element of the site.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS17
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS17 (8 m x 8 m) is a relatively small structure with a height of around 1 m (34.010΄ / 09.570΄).

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS18
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS18 (15 m x 11 m) is a relatively isolated mound at the edge of the Dam’Dam basin (33.974΄ / 09.537΄). It is the most westerly omb at DeurukRde’u rug. This structure is around 3 m in height and much of it has been lost to excavation.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS19
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS19 (15 m x 10 m) is situated near FS17 (34.008΄ / 09.612΄). It has a height of 2 m to 2.5 m.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS20
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS20 (12.5 m x 13.5 m) has had a trench and tunnel, 5 m in length, cut into its south flank (34.015΄ / 09.624΄). In close proximity to FS17, FS19 and FS20, there is another quadrate earthen platform (15 m x 15 m) that is elevated about 1 m above the surrounding terrain.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS21
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS21 (18 m x 13 m) is 3 m to 4 in height (34.042΄ / 09.612΄).

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS22
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS22 (23 m x 25 m) has a 1.5 m to 2 m deep concavity in the top, which appears to be the remains of an old excavation (34.061΄ / 09.639΄).

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS24
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS24 (39 m x 38 m) is the largest mount at DeurukRde’u rug. It is 5 m to 6 m in height, and has an undulating brush-covered top.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS25
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS25 (16 m x 18 m) is 2 m to 3.5 m in height (34.082΄ / 09.657΄).

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS26
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS26 (size unclear) is a highly eroded specimen, 1 m to 2.5 m in height (34.084΄ / 09.669΄).

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS27
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS27 (12 m x 13 m) is 2 m to 5 m in height (34.093΄ / 09.678΄). Much excavation of its south flank has occurred. A large excavation of the ground surface is found between FS26 and FS27. The spacing of the proximate bangsobang so suggests that a mound once stood here as well. It appears that under the pretext of gathering stones and earth for use in village construction projects, mounds such as FS27 are dismantled in the search for valuable artifacts.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS28
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS28 (19 m x 12 m) is around 4 m in height (34.190΄ / 09.712΄). Small excavations have been made in various parts of the structure.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS29
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS29 (29 m x 19 m) is around 4 m in height (34.112΄ / 09.736΄). It has a rear flank flush with the slope and a forward flank elevated about 4 m above the downhill slope.
